Condition.description: WHERE clause condition that can be combined with others.
Condition.title: Condition

ContentReasoning.description:
Reasoning content.

See the specification for [thinking blocks](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/build-with-claude/extended-thinking#understanding-thinking-blocks) for Claude models.
ContentReasoning.title: ContentReasoning

DocumentCitation.description: A citation that refers to a page range in a document.
DocumentCitation.title: DocumentCitation

DocumentRange.description: A range specifying a section of a document.
DocumentRange.title: DocumentRange

Error.description: Scan error (runtime error which occurred during scan).
Error.title: Error

JsonChange.description: Describes a change to data using JSON Patch format.
JsonChange.title: JsonChange

LoggerEvent.description: Log message recorded with Python logger.
LoggerEvent.title: LoggerEvent

Logprobs.description: Log probability information for a completion choice.
Logprobs.title: Logprobs

ProjectConfig-Input.description:
Scout project configuration from scout.yaml.

Extends ScanJobConfig to represent project-level defaults. All fields
from ScanJobConfig are available as project defaults.
ProjectConfig-Input.title: ProjectConfig

ProjectConfig-Output.description:
Scout project configuration from scout.yaml.

Extends ScanJobConfig to represent project-level defaults. All fields
from ScanJobConfig are available as project defaults.
ProjectConfig-Output.title: ProjectConfig

ProvenanceData.description: Metadata about who made an edit and why.
ProvenanceData.title: ProvenanceData

ResponseSchema.description: Schema for model response when using Structured Output.
ResponseSchema.title: ResponseSchema

ResponseSchema-Input.description: Schema for model response when using Structured Output.
ResponseSchema-Input.title: ResponseSchema

ResponseSchema-Output.description: Schema for model response when using Structured Output.
ResponseSchema-Output.title: ResponseSchema

SampleLimitEvent.description: The sample was unable to finish processing due to a limit
SampleLimitEvent.title: SampleLimitEvent

ScanRow.description:
Flat scan row for API response - maps directly to client grid columns.

Fields are either:
- Extracted from source types (using model_fields to avoid duplication)
- Transformed/flattened from nested structures
- Computed aggregates
ScanRow.title: ScanRow

ScoreEdit.description: A single edit to a score.
ScoreEdit.title: ScoreEdit

ScoreEditEvent.description: Event recorded when a score is edited.
ScoreEditEvent.title: ScoreEditEvent

ScoreEvent.description:
Event with score.

Can be the final score for a `Sample`, or can be an intermediate score
resulting from a call to `score`.
ScoreEvent.title: ScoreEvent

SpanBeginEvent.description: Mark the beginning of a transcript span.
SpanBeginEvent.title: SpanBeginEvent

SpanEndEvent.description: Mark the end of a transcript span.
SpanEndEvent.title: SpanEndEvent

StepEvent.description: Step within current sample or subtask.
StepEvent.title: StepEvent

StoreEvent.description: Change to data within the current `Store`.
StoreEvent.title: StoreEvent

ToolCallContent.description: Content to include in tool call view.
ToolCallContent.title: ToolCallContent

ToolCallView.description:
Custom view of a tool call.

Both `context` and `call` are optional. If `call` is not specified
then the view will default to a syntax highlighted Python function call.
ToolCallView.title: ToolCallView

ToolInfo.description:
Specification of a tool (JSON Schema compatible)

If you are implementing a ModelAPI, most LLM libraries can
be passed this object (dumped to a dict) directly as a function
specification. For example, in the OpenAI provider:

```python
ChatCompletionToolParam(
    type="function",
    function=tool.model_dump(exclude_none=True),
)
```

In some cases the field names don't match up exactly. In that case
call `model_dump()` on the `parameters` field. For example, in the
Anthropic provider:

```python
ToolParam(
    name=tool.name,
    description=tool.description,
    input_schema=tool.parameters.model_dump(exclude_none=True),
)
```
ToolInfo.title: ToolInfo

ToolParams.description: Description of tool parameters object in JSON Schema format.
ToolParams.title: ToolParams

TopLogprob.description: List of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position.
TopLogprob.title: TopLogprob

Transcript.description: Transcript info and transcript content (messages and events).
Transcript.title: Transcript

UrlCitation.description: A citation that refers to a URL.
UrlCitation.title: UrlCitation

ValidationCase.description:
Validation case for comparing to scanner results.

A `ValidationCase` specifies the ground truth for a scan of particular id (e.g. transcript id, message id, etc.

Use `target` for single-value or dict validation.
Use `labels` for validating resultsets with label-specific expectations.
ValidationCase.title: ValidationCase

ValidationEntry.description: A single validation result with its target.
ValidationEntry.title: ValidationEntry

f1.description: Harmonic mean of precision and recall.
f1.title: F1

precision.description: TP / (TP + FP). None if no positive predictions.
precision.title: Precision

recall.description: TP / (TP + FN). None if no positive targets.
recall.title: Recall

specificity.description: TN / (TN + FP). None if no negative targets.
specificity.title: Specificity

Worklist.description: List of transcript ids to process for a scanner.
Worklist.title: Worklist

get.description: Returns app config including transcripts and scans directories.
Returns the project configuration from scout.yaml. The ETag header contains a hash of the file for conditional updates.

put.description: Updates the project configuration in scout.yaml while preserving comments and formatting. Optionally include If-Match header with current ETag for optimistic concurrency control. Omit If-Match to force save.

parameters.description: ETag from GET request (optional, omit to force save)
parameters.name: if-match

schema.description: ETag from GET request (optional, omit to force save)
schema.title: If-Match

get.description: Returns info about all registered scanners.
Returns info on all currently running scans.

post.description: Returns scans from specified directory. Optional filter condition uses SQL-like DSL. Optional order_by for sorting results. Optional pagination for cursor-based pagination.
Returns distinct values for a column, optionally filtered.

schema.title: Response Scans Distinct Scans  Dir  Distinct Post

delete.description: Deletes a scan directory. Returns 409 Conflict if scan is active.

get.description: Returns detailed status and metadata for a single scan.
Streams scanner results as Arrow IPC format with LZ4 compression. Excludes input column for efficiency; use the input endpoint for input text.
get.summary: Get scanner dataframe containing results for all transcripts

get.description: Returns the original input text for a specific scanner result. The input type is returned in the X-Input-Type response header.

parameters.description: UUID of the specific result row
parameters.name: uuid

schema.description: UUID of the specific result row
schema.title: Uuid

get.summary: Get scanner input for a specific transcript

post.description: Runs a scan using llm_scanner with the provided ScanJobConfig.

get.description: Returns current topic versions dict for polling clients.
SSE endpoint that pushes topic versions when they change. Each message is a JSON dict mapping topic names to timestamps.

post.description: Returns transcripts from specified directory. Optional filter condition uses SQL-like DSL. Optional order_by for sorting results. Optional pagination for cursor-based pagination.
Returns distinct values for a column, optionally filtered.

schema.title: Response Transcripts Distinct Transcripts  Dir  Distinct Post

get.description: Returns transcript metadata without messages or events.

Returns JSON bytes for transcript messages and events. May be compressed (check Content-Encoding or X-Content-Encoding headers). JSON may contain a top-level 'attachments' dict; strings within 'messages' and 'events' may contain 'attachment://<32-char-hex-id>' refs that must be resolved client-side by looking up the ID in the 'attachments' dict. Use X-Accept-Raw-Encoding header to bypass server transcoding and receive bytes in the source compression format (e.g., zstd); client must decompress.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of compression algorithms the client application can decompress in code (e.g., 'zstd'). Use this for algorithms browsers don't natively support. If the source uses a listed algorithm, raw compressed bytes are returned with X-Content-Encoding header (not Content-Encoding, so the browser won't attempt decompression). Otherwise, server transcodes to deflate for automatic browser decompression.
parameters.name: x-accept-raw-encoding

schema.description: Comma-separated list of compression algorithms the client application can decompress in code (e.g., 'zstd'). Use this for algorithms browsers don't natively support. If the source uses a listed algorithm, raw compressed bytes are returned with X-Content-Encoding header (not Content-Encoding, so the browser won't attempt decompression). Otherwise, server transcodes to deflate for automatic browser decompression.
schema.title: X-Accept-Raw-Encoding

application/octet-stream.description: Raw compressed bytes when X-Accept-Raw-Encoding header matches the source compression (e.g., zstd). Check X-Content-Encoding header for the compression format.

get.description: Scans the project directory for validation files (.csv, .yaml, .json, .jsonl) and returns their URIs.

post.description: Creates a new validation file at the specified path with optional initial cases. Returns the URI of the created file.

delete.description: Deletes a validation file from the project.

schema.title: Response Delete Validation Validations  Uri  Delete

get.description: Returns all cases from a validation file.

schema.title: Response Get Validation Cases Validations  Uri  Get

put.description: Renames a validation file. Returns the new URI.

schema.title: Response Rename Validation Validations  Uri  Rename Put

delete.description: Deletes a case from a validation file.

schema.title: Response Delete Validation Case Validations  Uri   Case Id  Delete

get.description: Returns a specific case from a validation file by ID.

schema.title: Response Get Validation Case Validations  Uri   Case Id  Get

post.description: Creates or updates a case in a validation file. If the case ID exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new case will be created.

schema.title: Response Upsert Validation Case Validations  Uri   Case Id  Post
